unnormalised: ## Yoga Practices: My Journey from Chaos to Calm
normalised: Yoga Practices: My Journey from Chaos to Calm

unnormalised: Namaste everyone! I wanted to share a bit about my personal journey with yoga practices and how it completely transformed my lifestyle. I used to be perpetually stressed, juggling work deadlines, family responsibilities (you know, the usual Delhi chaos!). Sleepless nights became the norm, and I felt constantly on edge. My breaking point was sometime around 20/10/2022 when I collapsed from exhaustion.

I used to be perpetually stressed, juggling work deadlines, family responsibilities (you know, the usual Delhi chaos!). Sleepless nights became the norm, and I felt constantly on edge. My breaking point was sometime around twentieth october two thousand and twenty two when I collapsed from exhaustion.

unnormalised: A family friend, Priya aunty, suggested I try yoga. Initially, I was skeptical. I pictured pretzel-like contortions impossible for my stiff, 30-something body. But desperation pushed me to join a beginner's class at the local Patanjali Yoga Kendra.
normalised: A family friend, Priya aunty, suggested I try yoga. Initially, I was skeptical. I pictured pretzel-like contortions impossible for my stiff, thirty something body. But desperation pushed me to join a beginner's class at the local Patanjali Yoga Kendra.

unnormalised: The first class at 06:30 hrs was a revelation. Simple breathing exercises like Pranayama felt incredibly calming. Slowly, I progressed from basic Asanas to more challenging ones. My instructor, Guru Sharmaji, emphasized mindful movement and listening to my body. There were days, especially after a late night trying to meet deadlines for my office in Gurgaon, when all I could manage was a few minutes of Shavasana (corpse pose), but even that made a difference.
normalised: The first class at six thirty hours was a revelation. Simple breathing exercises like Pranayama felt incredibly calming. Slowly, I progressed from basic Asanas to more challenging ones. unnormalised: Now, a year later (as of 01/01/2024), yoga is an integral part of my routine. I feel more centered, focused, and much less reactive to stress. It has also significantly improved my sleep quality. My back pain, aggravated by long hours at the computer, has also reduced considerably. I still struggle with certain poses, but the journey itself has been incredibly rewarding. If you're considering incorporating yoga into your lifestyle, I highly recommend giving it a try. You might just surprise yourself! What are your experiences with yoga? Share them in the comments!
